thread.title: China charges 10 with repackaging, selling old meat
thread.title_full: China charges 10 with repackaging, selling old meat | News24

author: news24.com
title: China charges 10 with repackaging, selling old meat
text:
Beijing - Shanghai prosecutors say they are charging people connected to a US meat supplier's Chinese subsidiary with producing and selling fake and substandard products.
Shanghai Husi Food, which is a unit of OSI Group of Aurora, Illinois, has been under investigation since a Shanghai TV station reported last year that it repackaged and sold old meat. The scandal alarmed Chinese diners and disrupted operations for fast food brands.
The Shanghai prosecutor's office said in a statement that prosecutors from Shanghai's Jiading district brought the cases against 10 defendants, including some connected to Husi's facilities in Shanghai and Hebei province.
OSI said in a statement that it would address the charges "according to legal procedures" and that it has "confidence in China's legal system".
